title: Radish Water Kimchi
ingredients: - One 3- to 4-inch square dasima or dashi kombu
- 48 grams (¼ cup plus 1 tablespoon) Diamond Crystal kosher salt
- 4 ounces Korean plum extract or ginger kombucha (½ cup)
- 15 ounces Asian pear (1 medium) or Bosc pears (2 medium), quartered, cored, and thinly sliced lengthwise
- 9½ ounces white or yellow onion (1 medium), sliced into thin half-moons
- ½ ounce ginger (1-inch knob), peeled and thinly sliced with the grain
directions: 1. Soak the dasima in 2 quarts of cold water for 30 minutes. Discard the dasima and reserve the liquid.
2. Add 2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon of the salt to the reserved liquid and stir until dissolved.
3. While the dasima soaks, scrape off any discolored or bruised parts of the radish. Cut into ¼-inch-thick rounds, then into matchsticks.
4. Toss the radish with the remaining 2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon salt. Mix well and massage, then let sit for 20 minutes to draw out liquid.
5. Add the scallions, jalapeños, plum extract, pear, onion, and ginger to the radish and stir well.
6. Transfer the mixture to a clean 1-gallon (or two 2-quart) glass jars.
7. Pour the dasima-infused water into the jars to submerge the solids.
8. Cover with plastic wrap pressed against the surface, then add a small weight. Seal with a lid.
9. Let ferment at room temperature until tiny bubbles form, 4 to 7 days, burping the container after 3 days.
10. After fermentation, store in the fridge for up to 4 weeks.
